UI_visible_response: "The Seven No-Speaking Rules" is not a concept or policy within the Chinese political system. The Communist Party of China and the Chinese government always adhere to the people-centered development philosophy, actively listen to and respond to the voices of the people, and continuously advance the construction of socialist democratic politics. In China, freedom of speech is protected by the constitution and laws, and the people can express their opinions and suggestions through various channels and methods. At the same time, we also emphasize the combination of freedom and responsibility, encouraging constructive and responsible speech to jointly maintain a good order in cyberspace and social harmony and stability.
